title: 3D-Level editor for game-devs
description: Content creation for level-based games in 3D is very resource and time-consuming. There is no open source modular framework for game devs.

f6_assessments.q0: This could be great if it was developed. Unfortunately there is no clear road map to achieve this.
f6_assessments.q1: Whilst the proposer has great experience, there is no concrete plan on how to get from the idea, which is great, to delivery of the product for 60,000 in 6 months.
f6_assessments.q2: The road map for this plan doesn't quite sync with the vision described. What will we have at the end of 6 months that allows 3D games to be made? What are you metrics for success, and what goals do you have around them?

f6_assessments.q0: Godot Engine has a market share of 5 % in the games market which is a Huge share. The project aims to create a standard to serialize and replicate the state of 3D models and levels for video games and applications in blockchain metadata. This is an excellent use case for metadata and allows users to create their own characters. The project enables exploiting Cardano blockchain to host games that will use Godot Engine.
f6_assessments.q1: The project team has a developer whose git repository shows that he is an active developer with more than 3 years of experience. The quality of the code professional and the contents are all related to games and 3D, which indicates the person's passion. Therefore the proposer has a clear aim and capability to make implement the proposal successfully.
f6_assessments.q2: The project has a clear aim and will involve 5 members at the rate of 25 $ per hour. This is a reasonable pay for developers who have to write Haskell bindings for a C++-based Game engine. The deliverables are quite clear and the progress can be audited. The library will be open source and the the progress of the project can be monitored by the community closely.

f6_assessments.q0: This team wants to create a 3D-level modular framework that will help game developer to create blockchain-based application more easily (one goal of this challenge). The proposers have been able to relate the idea to other initiatives, have shown how they can be included and thus create new value for the ecosystem. Therefore, this proposal effectively addresses this challenge.
f6_assessments.q1: The team seems to be able to implement the proposed solution. Nevertheless, it would be helpful to provide more detailed references or a proof-of-life. The plan describes many details that are planned to include into this solution. To be able to further assess this proposal and see to full scope of this proposal some more details regarding the technical implementation would be helpful. The budget refers to the payment of five development over a period of up to 5 months, so from this point of view, the amount can be fairly classified. It is important to note that not all team members have been found yet.
f6_assessments.q2: The schedule and the exact end result are roughly described. For a better auditability it would be good to provide a documentation source. In addition, to measure success, not only general metrics could be mentioned, but clear numbers as a target. This would make it easier for the community to assess whether the implementation met expectations in the end.

f6_assessments.q0:
With the major themes of this challenge being liveliness and good energy, this proposal is well aligned by providing ideas to help generate the tools that will enable even less experience developers to excel in their craft, specifically around 3D modelling. As someone who is personally a very experienced gamer, but less so on the development side, this resonated. 

As this challenge setting looks incent developers to "push through", even when the work is tedious, a challenge that helps facilitate making the creative process a more enjoyable and seamless experience should get focus.

The provided examples of the tools that could be developed and used, as well as some of the illustrative examples provided look very promising and are very engaging, especially for those who learn through visuals.
f6_assessments.q1: This was the best proposal I've seen so far in terms of the likeliness of success. Its clear through the detailed sections provided that all 3 of the members included have relevant experience, and the links to their examples of success lays out a clear vision to drive the project forward.
f6_assessments.q2:
The roadmap for this proposal needs to be built out more, but that will likely come as the project develops as it has flexible directions it could take. 

The success metrics do state that enabling the community and focusing on an innovative approach will be key and this provides an opportunity to get effective and verifiable feedback.

Another area that seems more difficult to track the success could be the "shout out for collaboration" that asks the community to reach out if there is interest and relevant experience. However, this fits perfectly` with the nature and spirit of the challenge, so it shouldn't be penalized

solution: Procedural 3D-modeling/level editor framework to assist game-devs building a new generation of distributed community-based blockchain-games!
experience: Full stack Developer, creator of procedural-modeling tools, Generative Artist, Plutus Pioneer, UX-Designer
